definition: unpleasant to the eye/objectionable
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
(negative prefix)/not/no
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Maybe they don't see eye to eye.
sentences.chinese: 也许它们彼此看不顺眼。

sentences.english: My father frowns on all but the most conventional of dress.
sentences.chinese: 除最普通的服装外，我父亲都看不顺眼。

sentences.english: Feng Mian Street on the day attracted foreign goods could not comment.
sentences.chinese: 冯老爷子对天街招来洋品牌看不顺眼。

sentences.english: Whose eye is never pleased has more than tired eyes.
sentences.chinese: 对什么都看不顺眼的人，疲劳的一定不仅仅是眼睛。

definition: cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
unable to get along together/incompatible
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to quarrel
to glower at each other (idiom)
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
hate (due to envy etc)
